keyword: calories in a cup of flour
title: Calories in a Cup of Flour
meta_description: Discover calories in a cup of flour, including carbs, protein, fat, full nutrition breakdown per 100 g basis, and preparation tweaks for baking.
h1: Calories in a Cup of Flour
assumptions: All-purpose white flour, unsifted, spooned and leveled (1 cup ≈ 125 g).
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by flour type, brand, measuring method (sifted vs. packed), and density; check packaging when available.

quick_answer.text: One cup of all-purpose flour provides ~455 kcal, mostly from carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a cup of all-purpose flour?
What are the carbs in a cup of flour?
faqs.a: Roughly 95 g carbs, with 3 g fiber and minimal sugars.
Yes, ~13 g protein per cup, mainly gluten.

faqs.q: How does measuring affect calories in flour?
faqs.a: Spooned is ~125 g (455 kcal); packed can be 140-150 g and higher calories.

faqs.q: Calories in whole wheat vs. white flour per cup?
faqs.a: Whole wheat is ~425 kcal per cup, with more fiber (~12 g) but similar carbs.
